perturbation.original_text: (f) "Major Tournament" shall mean any of the following tournaments: the Masters, the U.S. Open, the British Open and the PGA Championship.
perturbation.changed_text: (f) "Major Tournament" shall mean any golf tournament that TPC, in its sole discretion, deems to be of significant marketing value.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of "Major Tournament" is specific and aligns with common understanding in the golf world. The modified definition introduces ambiguity and allows TPC to unilaterally decide what constitutes a "Major Tournament," potentially reducing bonus payments to Ogle. This contradicts the intended meaning and creates uncertainty in enforcement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles of good faith and fair dealing; potential violation of implied duty of good faith.

perturbation.original_text:
8. RETAINER FEE. In consideration of the rights and benefits granted to TPC hereunder, TPC agrees to pay Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle a retainer fee in each Contract Year during the Contract Period ("Retainer Fee") in accordance with the following schedule:

CONTRACT YEAR RETAINER FEE
First (1st) Contract Year Fifty-Five Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1996-Dec. 31, 1996) Dollars ($55,000)
Second (2nd) Contract Year Seventy Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1997-Dec. 31, 1997) Dollars (70,000)
Third (3rd) Contract Year Ninety Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1998-Dec. 31, 1998) Dollars ($90,000)

Said Retainer Fee shall be paid in four (4) equal installments on or before the first (1st) day of February, May, August and November in each Contract Year.
perturbation.changed_text:
8. RETAINER FEE. In consideration of the rights and benefits granted to TPC hereunder, TPC agrees to pay Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle a discretionary payment, termed here as the "Retainer Fee" in each Contract Year during the Contract Period. The actual payment, if any, will be determined at TPC's sole discretion based on Ogle's overall performance and TPC's financial status.

CONTRACT YEAR POTENTIAL PAYMENT
First (1st) Contract Year Up to Fifty-Five Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1996-Dec. 31, 1996) Dollars ($55,000)
Second (2nd) Contract Year Up to Seventy Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1997-Dec. 31, 1997) Dollars (70,000)
Third (3rd) Contract Year Up to Ninety Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1998-Dec. 31, 1998) Dollars ($90,000)

Any payment, if made, shall be disbursed at TPC's convenience, with no fixed schedule.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause establishes a clear obligation for TPC to pay a fixed "Retainer Fee." The modified clause transforms this into a discretionary payment, contradicting the original intent and the common understanding of a retainer fee. The changed language makes the payment contingent on TPC's discretion, potentially rendering the clause unenforceable due to lack of consideration. This is a misaligned terminology because a true retainer fee is non-discretionary.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract; lack of consideration; potential violation of implied duty of good faith.

perturbation.original_text: 11. ROYALTY COMPENSATION FOR ENDORSED PRODUCT. In addition to the Retainer Fee, Tournament Bonuses and Money List Bonuses set forth in Paragraphs 8, 9 and 10 above, TPC agrees to pay Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle royalty compensation of ten percent (10%) of the net sales of all Endorsed Products distributed or sold during the Contract Period in or to the Countries of Australia and New Zealand ("Royalty Compensation"). "Net sales" shall mean the gross invoice price billed to customers, less customary trade/quantity discounts, rebates and returns actually credited, but with no deductions of any kind. No costs incurred by TPC in the manufacture, advertisement, promotion or exploitation of any Endorsed Product shall be deducted as a cost in calculating the net sales. TPC agrees to guarantee to Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle a minimum Royalty Compensation of Twenty Thousand U.S. Dollars ($20,000) payable in four (4) equal installments of Five Thousand U.S. Dollars ($5,000) and due simultaneously with the Retainer Fee on or before the first (1st) day of February, May, August and November in each Contract Year.
perturbation.changed_text: 11. ROYALTY COMPENSATION FOR ENDORSED PRODUCT. In addition to the Retainer Fee, Tournament Bonuses and Money List Bonuses set forth in Paragraphs 8, 9 and 10 above, TPC agrees to consider providing a potential royalty payment, called the "Royalty Consideration", for products sold. The calculation of this Royalty Consideration, if offered, will be at TPC's sole discretion, based on internal sales metrics. TPC might offer something, but does not guarantee a minimum Royalty Consideration.
perturbation.explanation: The initial segment distinctly outlines a fixed percentage for royalty payment. By modifying it, the mandatory compensation becomes a mere 'consideration', rendering it optional and subject to TPC's discretion. This alteration contradicts standard royalty agreements and is likely unenforceable due to its vague nature. A key element here is that royalty has a clear definition as being a set percentage. The changes introduce high degrees of legal ambiguity.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract; Lack of Consideration; Unjust Enrichment
